item.title: How to filter spam mails and block senders in Mail on Mac
item.description: If you’re on a spam mailing list and the unsuscribe option in Mail hasn’t worked, here are some alternate ways of putting spam in the right place (out of your mailbox): 1. Use rules to automate spam identification and deletion If you find yourself manually identifying spam mail and then deleting it, creating a Rule can help automate that for you. Here’s an example of a rule I use to delete spam mail before I even see them:

item.title: Siri Touch Typing Easter Egg in macOS
item.description: If you type the home row keys of the QWERTY layout into macOS’ Spotlight Search twice, Siri understands that you are touch typing. Steps to reproduce Make sure you’re connected to the Internet. Type asdfjkl;asdfjkl; into Spotlight Search.
